items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message:
Strong winds and spring tides may cause large waves and spray overtopping on the coast and Humber Estuary tomorrow morning.
Tides are expected to be higher than usual due to the forecast weather conditions during coming tides.
Areas most at risk include low lying coastal frontages, in particular around Kilnsea and Spurn Road .
Flooding is possible between 07:30 AM and 09:45 AM on Monday 26/09/2022.
The next high tide is expected to be higher than normal and may result in us issuing a further alert.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 26/09/2022, or as the situation changes.
